metadata.title: CVE-2024-26890 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: btrtl: fix out of bounds memory access The problem is detectedby KASAN. btrtl driver uses private hci data to store 'structbtrealtek_data'. If btrtl driver is used with btusb, then memory forprivate hci data is allocated in btusb. But no private data is allocatedafter hci_dev, when btrtl is used with hci_h5. This commit adds memoryallocation for hci_h5 case.================================================================== BUG:KASAN: slab-out-of-bounds in btrtl_initialize+0x6cc/0x958 [btrtl] Write ofsize     Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
